intro: Witheringia diploconos, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, sturdy stems and showy, violet-blue petals that bloom in late summer. The plant produces distinctive, spiky seed heads that persist into winter, adding visual interest to the landscape. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils. Witheringia diploconos is a popular choice for native gardens due to its ecological benefits and ornamental value.
